conclusion: The problem involves analyzing the U-I graphs of a power source and a small light bulb.
The graph shows two lines: a straight line representing the power source and a curved line representing the small light bulb.
The intersection point of the power source's U-I line and the light bulb's U-I curve indicates the operating point of the circuit.
The intersection point is at \\( I = 2 \, \text{A} \\) and \\( U = 2 \, \text{V} \\).
The output power of the power source is calculated as \\( P_{\text{out}} = U \times I \\).
At the intersection point, \\( U = 2 \, \text{V} \\) and \\( I = 2 \, \text{A} \\).
The EMF of the power source is the y-intercept of its U-I line, which is \\( 3 \, \text{V} \\).
The total power of the power source is calculated as \\( P_{\text{total}} = \text{EMF} \times I \\).
The EMF is \\( 3 \, \text{V} \\) and the current is \\( 2 \, \text{A} \\).
The final answer is the output power and the total power of the power source.
The output power is \\( 4 \, \text{W} \\) and the total power is \\( 6 \, \text{W} \\).
